B2 unable to speak or act in the usual way because of having had too much alcohol: I got completely drunk at my sister's wedding. I'd had a couple of glasses of wine but I certainly wasn't drunk. He came home last night blind (= extremely) drunk. drunk and disorderly law
  specialized
If someone is drunk and disorderly, they are committing the crime of behaving badly in public after drinking too much alcohol: He was charged with disturbing the peace by being drunk and disorderly.
See more drunk with power
having a strong and unreasonable feeling of being able to control other people: He was accused of arrogance and being drunk with power.
